Hello and hope you are doing well.It's unlikely that anemia is causing your symptoms. Did you mean you have pain in the right upper quadrant of the abdomen? Right upper quadrant pain and white stool could indicate disorders in the liver or gall bladder. If the pain is due to a problem from the liver like hepatitis, you should have associated symptoms like nausea and vomiting. The pain could be from the gall bladder too. It could be if there is a stone in the gall bladder or if its wall is inflamed.Discuss these options with your consulting doctor, he may advise blood tests for liver function tests and maybe to do an abdominal ultrasonography to rule out hepatic enlargement or any stones in the gall bladder.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.

Hello and hope you are doing well.Any disease which affects the liver will show changes in the liver function tests. Any structural abnormalities can be detected by an ultrasonography or CT scan. Diabetes Mellitus and Hypothyroidism could also cause the symptoms described by you. A simple blood test could help detect diabetes and hypothyroidism. Consult your primary care physician for these tests and repeat them if they have not been done recently.Hope this helped and do keep us posted.
